intro: Andira marauensis, commonly known as the Marau evergreen, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10-20 meters, with smooth, dark bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated by insects, while its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Andira marauensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
